usefulItems: bowl, thermal serving bowl or other large bowl
title: Tomato basil chicken stew

ingredients.content: 40 g Parmesan cheese, crust removed and cut into pieces (3 cm)
150 g brown onion, cut into quarters
200 g carrot, cut into pieces (3-4 cm)
3 - 4 sprigs fresh basil, leaves only (approx. 20 g), plus extra for garnishing
2 celery stalks, cut into pieces (3-4 cm)
800 g skinless chicken thigh fillets, cut into cubes (4 cm)
½ tsp ground black pepper, to season
800 g canned cannellini beans, rinsed and drained (approx. 500 g after draining)

preparations.content: Place Parmesan into mixing bowl and grate <b>10 sec/speed 10<b>. Transfer into a bowl and set aside.
Place oil, onion, carrot, garlic, basil and celery into mixing bowl and chop <b>5 sec/speed 5<b>
Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula, then sauté <b>5 min/Varoma/speed 1<b>.

Add tomatoes, white wine, tomato paste, oregano and paprika and cook <b>5 min/100°C/speed 1<b>, then blend <b>30 sec/speed 1<b>, <b> increasing speed gradually from speed 1 to speed 7.<b> Scrape down side of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add chicken, salt and pepper and cook <b>10 min/100°C//speed <b>, placing simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid.

Place cannellini beans into thermal serving bowl or other large bowl. Add chicken stew and stir to combine. Cover to keep warm and set aside for 2 minutes. Transfer into serving bowls and garnish with reserved Parmesan cheese and extra basil leaves before serving.

hintsAndTricks: You can replace the chicken thigh fillets with chicken breasts in this recipe.
